Dear Harry:
Recently I had word from your office that the eight series
from your offerings which we plan to carry in our 19^6 Tape
Catalog Supplement made with your approval* I appreciated
getting this clearance* As you recall, the programs in
question were:
Roots of Jazz
Know Your Neighbors
What’s The Big Idea 'I
World of Wonders ^
Ways of Mankind - "y’7
i 3.
The Jeffersonian Heritage^,
A Survey of the Madrigal \73>
Man1s Right to Knowledge
and the Free Use Thereof ^
Wou^d it be possible for y©u to send tapes or disc recordings
of these series to the National Tape Repository at Kent State
University, where tape masters for our use could be prepared
and the originals returned to you? If this is possible, it
would save us much time* If you cannot do this, then it will
be necessary for us to go back to the producers, all of whom
have given us permission to carry their materials*
May I have a reply to this matter quickly, so that if necessary,
I can contact the producers? Thank you very much.
ALH:JMC
cc: Dr. Ralph H.
Sincerely,
Anna L. Hyer
Associate Executive Secretary
